article: Over half the world's people now live in cities. The latest "Global Report on Human Settlements" says a _ change took place last year. The report came out this week from U.N. Habitat, a United Nations agency.  A century ago, _ than five percent of all people lived in cities. By the middle of this century it could be seventy percent, or almost six and a half billion people. Already three-fourths of people in _ countries live in cities. Now most urban population _ is in the developing world.  Urbanization can _ to social and economic progress, but also put _ on cities to provide housing and _ . The new report says almost two hundred thousand people move into cities and towns each day. It says worsening inequalities, _ by social divisions and differences in _ , could result in violence and crime unless cities plan better.  Another issue is urban sprawl . This is where cities _ quickly into rural areas, sometimes at a much faster rate than urban population growth.  Sprawl is _ in the United States. Americans move a lot. In a recent study, Art Hall at the University of Kansas found that people are moving away from the _ cities to smaller ones. He sees a _ toward "de-urbanization" across the nation. But urban economies still provide many _ that rural areas do not.  www.k@s@5@u.com   ####
